competencies.name: Operative identifies the main types of clinical/healthcare waste
Operative demonstrates caution and care handling clinical/healthcare wastes
Operative identifies the different types of clinical/healthcare waste using the standard colour-coding containment system
Operative correctly segregates clinical waste containers according to type and treatment required
Operative matches different types of clinical/healthcare waste to the relevant EWC documentation code
Operative correctly identifies incorrectly packaged clinical/healthcare wastes
competencies.supportingText:
1. What is the main difference between infectious clinical waste and offensive waste?
  2. What type of sack should be used for the disposal of offensive waste?
  3. What type of sack/container should be used for the disposal of clinical infectious wastes?

competencies.name: Operative segregates different types of clinical/healthcare waste and can state reasons for segregation
competencies.supportingText:
1. Why are different types of clinical waste segregated at source (or use comparative examples)?
  2. What are the different types of treatment/disposal used for the types of waste your company produces?
  3. Can you tell me what happens to the waste when it leaves this site?

competencies.name: Operative has obtained or received suitable preventative vaccinations for specified infectious diseases
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important to be vaccinated against certain infectious diseases?

competencies.name: Operative wears the correct personal protective clothing when handling clinical/healthcare wastes
Operative checks that sacks are correctly sealed before handling or transfer and takes remedial action where necessary
Operative carries/lifts loose sacks by the neck to minimise the potential for cross-contamination or injury
Operative demonstrates procedure for dealing with leaking containers containing clinical waste
Operative picks up sharps or rigid containers using handles provided and carrier out a visual inspection for correct closure
Operative selects the correct bulk container for different types of clinical/healthcare waste
Operative seeks assistance if unsure about the type of clinical/healthcare waste container or disposal route
competencies.supportingText:
1. What action would you take if you found an unlabelled yellow container and you were unsure about the contents?
  2. How do you identify where clinical waste bags have come from?

competencies.name: Operative demonstrates  internal procedure for reporting non-conformances
competencies.supportingText:
1. What action would you take if you found a leaking container containing infectious clinical waste?
  2. What would you do if you found a lack bag labelled as ‘clinical waste’?
  3. What is the different between a non-conformance and an accident?

competencies.name: Operative follows correct hand-washing or decontamination procedure before entering rest areas, eating, drinking etc
Operative ensures any cut or abrasion is suitably cleaned and covered before starting the handling process
competencies.supportingText:
1. If you had a cut on your hand, what action would you take before starting your collections?
  2. What are the potential risks of not covering an open wound when dealing with soiled/infectious materials?

competencies.name: Operative reports any injury, accident or near miss as per company procedure
competencies.supportingText:
1. What would you do if you injured your leg when moving some rigid waste containers?
  2. What is the company procedure for reporting accidents?

competencies.name: Operative correctly removes personal protective clothing at the workplace to be laundered or disposed of at required intervals
Operative correctly completes Duty of Care documentation prior to waste leaving the site
Operative locates spillage kit
Operative initiates and completes the appropriate spillage procedure in the event of a liquid or solid waste spillage e.g.  container leaking or splitting
Operative selects the correct items in the kit to safely clean up spillage
Operative selects or uses additional personal protective equipment required to prevent cross-contamination
Operative contains the spillage for safe onward handling and transfer
Operative reports spillage (and action taken) to supervisor and assists in completing a non-conformance report
competencies.supportingText:
1. What is the company procedure for reporting spillages?
  2. Why is it important to investigate the causes of a clinical waste spillage?

competencies.name: Operative correctly handles and manages the sharp implements  present in the clinical/healthcare waste streams
Operative selects the correct equipment to safely handle loose sharps
Operative selects and uses additional personal protective equipment required to prevent cross-contamination or needle-stick injury
Operative uses correct range of colour-coded containers to correctly contain contaminated sharps
Operative correctly contains sharps for safe onward handling and transfer
Operative implements the local procedure for dealing with a needle-stick injury
competencies.supportingText: 1. Describe how you would treat yourself or a colleague who had received a needle-stick injury.

competencies.name: Operative implements   the procedure for completing an accident form in the event of sharps injury
Operative reports sharps injury/non-conformance (and action taken) to supervisor and assists in completing relevant reports
competencies.supportingText:
1. What information do you need to provide to your supervisor for the report?
  2. How do you think needle-stick injuries can be avoided in the future?
